settings.title: Mimi Lu
settings.text_center:
Emeryville, California
Vice President of New Product Development & Marketing, Rose Inc

06:30 a.m.: Mornings are a bit chaotic. I get up 30 minutes before our two girls to get myself ready and prep our breakfasts. 

06:45 a.m.: My morning beauty routine is fast! Our Heliotrope Blush Divine is my usual go-to, but I also do love Dahlia for that pinch-and-flush of color. I like a neutral lip, so Beam works the best for me.

08:05 a.m.: My husband and I tag team drop-off depending on our meeting schedules. Half the time I take the first call as they are jumping out of the car…they are very used to mommy’s car meetings!

settings.desc:
6:00 a.m.: I wake up and walk my dog, Goldie, make coffee and do a 20-minute meditation which helps me to start the day with a clear mind.

7:00 a.m.: Projects that require the most brain power come first, like doing beauty industry research or working on formulas or shades. I’m a morning person so I’m fresh with all wheels spinning.

9:00 a.m.: I tackle emails and touch base with our East Coast and European teams.

One of the projects I’m really excited about is creating a new virtual try-on experience. I remember when I first started working at the makeup counter, people would try lipstick and smudge shadows on each other and either laugh at the absurdity or delight in the fabulousness. I’m working with a UK-based Amyris company called Beauty Labs to reimagine this experience virtually. There are still boundaries to push on how the power of makeup can create meaningful experiences and connect people from all over the world.

settings.text_center:
11:00 a.m.: I try to go to the gym daily and this has become my ideal time to go. 

12:00 p.m.: By noon I am ravenous. I have lunch with my husband, Josh, who also works at home. We eat at our dining room table together every day and watch the news. 

12:30 p.m.: Today is all about meetings. I try not to stay seated for more than two to three hours so I take a break by walking Goldie. This helps to keep my mind moving. I also try to do cryotherapy or an infrared sauna session twice a week. I’m very lucky to have a rejuvenation clinic on my block.

settings.quotes: “...other days I'm on set doing makeup for a photoshoot or live shopping events and pop-ups. Sometimes I’ll also travel to labs and work with the chemists on shade development.”

settings.text_center:
4:05 p.m.: My brain starts to tire around 4 p.m. I get into the product closet and start to play with formulas and shades while flipping through fashion and beauty magazines. So important for maintaining creative inspiration! 

5:30 p.m.: We go to the dog park and let Goldie play with her pals. We try to do this for 30 minutes every day.

settings.quotes: “I remember when I first started working at the makeup counter, people would try lipstick and smudge shadows on each other and either laugh at the absurdity or delight in the fabulousness.”

settings.desc:
7:00 p.m.: We eat dinner and watch TV. During the pandemic we started with a set menu for every day of the week and still keep to it. Josh cooks and I clean. It’s quite nice, actually. I’m desperately waiting for new seasons of Succession, Euphoria, Yellowstone and Ozark.

8:00 p.m.: I’ll finish up any work that needs to be addressed like last-minute emails, calls with the team in Asia or entering expenses.

9:00 p.m.: Bedtime is 9 p.m. on the dot. I’ll read for 30 minutes, then watch an episode of Judge Judy.

settings.title: Focus With Jason Hoffman
settings.text_center: From kicking off Rose Inc’s first live shopping event to doing makeup on set, it’s safe to say that beauty executive and makeup artist Jason Hoffman has been keeping busy. The key to his success lies in finding balance where he can  the workweek through daily walks, sauna sessions and the perfect playlist to inspire productivity.
